definition: to go the wrong way/to take the wrong (road, exit etc)
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver

sentences.english: The slightest misstep or gust of wind could cause him to fall off the wire.
sentences.chinese: 走錯一小步或輕微的風就能把他吹下鐵絲。

sentences.english: Go the wrong way to remember to love the wrong person to know how to let go.
sentences.chinese: 走錯了路饌要記得回頭愛錯了人要懂得放手。

sentences.english: If you're looking for a metronome, you've come to the wrong place.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在找一個節拍器，你已經走錯了地方了。

sentences.english: Black Furies : These women are brave, but they have lost the true path.
sentences.chinese: 這些女人很勇敢，但是她們走錯了路。
